intro: Manisuris guianensis, commonly known as the Guianan manisuris, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It is often found in tropical rainforests and is adapted to humid, shaded environments. The plant's latex is toxic and may serve as a defense mechanism against herbivores.
